change.item: Collection level finding aid created by Sheri Sarnoff
Jodi Boyle oversaw conversion of html box and folder list to EAD and updated overall finding aid, especially with revised biographical information, new subject terms.

repository.corpname: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

did.abstract: The collection contains seven plays in English on theater, dance, and German literature.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Jodi Boyle with data entry by David Abril Torres.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Dance critic, author, poet, translator, and painter, Walter Sorell was born in Vienna in 1905. He attended the University of Vienna but later settled in New York in 1939 after fleeing the Nazis. Sorell was well known as the New York dance critic for the Providence Journal and a contributor to other dance publications. He also wrote over 25 books in German and English and translated others from German into English. He published plays and poetry, did radio broadcasts, and exhibited his paintings. Sorrel lived in New York and Zurich. He died at the Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center in New York on February 21, 1997 leaving behind his wife, Gertrude Maria, a step-son, two granddaughters, and three great-granddaughters.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains manuscripts, some with corrections, of seven plays in English on theater, dance, and German literature.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged alphabetically. There are no series.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The provenance of this collection is unknown.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming with the laws of copyright. Whenever possible, the M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives will provide information about copyright owners and other restrictions, but the legal determination ultimately rests with the researcher. Requests for permission to publish material from this collection should be discussed with the Head of Special Collections and Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows: Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, Walter Sorell Papers, Undated. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the Sorell Papers).

did.unittitle: Dreams on a Willow Tree; a television play in three acts
Egypt Hill; a play in two acts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Carbon copy of typescript. Various pagings.

did.unittitle: The End of the Tether; a serious comedy in three parts.
Everyman Today; a modern morality play.
The Flowering of the Barren Fig Tree; a requiem

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copy of typescript with handwritten corrections in ink. Penciled notations concerning the music to accompaniment. 93 p.

did.unittitle: Olivia and a Dream or Right You Are, Pirandello, If You Think So; a comedy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Typescript title page. Other pages are copies and carbon copies of typescript.
